page.title: 19STOKE FLEMING CHURCH
page.content:
{St Peters Church}is near the middle of the village.It has a square tower which contains the bells. It is used as a{landmark}by ships. It has quite a large grave-yard.The oldest grave there was made in{1840}and it is at the back of the Church.The older gravestones were taken up and used as paving stones at{Farwell House}when it was the Rectory. Inside the church is the{pulpit which is carved out of oak.It has four panels with animals carved on them between these are angels.It was carved by{Miss Pinwill}in{1891. The church is well known for it's early{brass}with the figures of{John {Corp}and his grandaughter,{Elyenore. Many people take rubbings of this.
.
